isis.stitle: VT 275 Engine Service Manual - Cylinder Head and Valve Train - Removal - Fuel Injectors

note.para: There is no need to drain fuel rail when removing an injector.

step1.para: Disconnect the injector harness from the injector connector.

figure.caption: Releasing the injector connector from rocker arm carrier

calloutgroup.callout1: Injector Connector Remover tool used with handle in cylinders 1, 2, 6
Injector Connector Remover tool used without handle in cylinders 3, 5
Injector Connector Remover tool used without handle in cylinder 4

note.para: The above injector connector removal procedures are based upon the assumption that the engine is out of the vehicle.

step1.para: Release injector connectors by using the Injector Connector Remover tool. See Special Service Tools.

note.para: On some connectors you must remove the tool handle, fit the remover portion onto connector and use a screwdriver or other tool to push down and release connector.

step1.para: Push down on the injector connector to release it from the rocker arm carrier.

figure.caption: Loosen fuel injector hold down clamp

step1.para: Use the Fuel Injector Hold Down Wrench to loosen the fuel injector hold down clamp assembly. See Special Service Tools.

figure.caption: Removing the fuel injector from cylinder head

calloutgroup.callout1: Fuel injector hold down clamp assembly

step1.para: Remove fuel injector from cylinder head bore by lifting injector and hold down clamp assembly straight up and out.
Place each fuel injector into the Injector Holder Rack. See Special Service Tools.

note.para: If just removing or replacing any of the injectors and not the sleeves, clean injector sleeve with the Injector Sleeve Brush. See Special Service Tools. If you will be proceeding with cylinder head reconditioning, you may skip this step.
